ygData.subject: Question Re: HyperNEAT Speciate
ygData.msgSnippet: ExperimentRun::finishEvaluations should be called before GeneticPopulation::produceNextGeneration.  As long as you do that, generation 0 will have species.

ExperimentRun::finishEvaluations should be called before
GeneticPopulation:=
:produceNextGeneration.  As long as you do that,
generation 0 will have spe=
cies.  You shouldn't get the exception as
long as you don't call produceNex=
tGeneration before finishEvaluations.
 Notice how there is a "generations>0=
" if within that for loop.

Sorry for making it backwards like that, but if=
 I put the
produceNextGeneration at the end of the for loop instead of doin=
g it
the way I did, then it would produce an extra generation at the end
th=
at would not get used.

As a side note, I found out that within the Genetic=
Species::makeBabies
routine, it can get stuck in an infinite loop.  I'm not=
 sure how it
happend, but until I figure it out, I've replaced the while(tr=
ue)
loops with for loops which try 1,000,000 times and then bail by
choosin=
g the most fit in the species and doing asexual reproduction. 
It's only ha=
ppend once so it might never happen to you, but just
thought I'd let you kn=
ow.

I've made several other improvements too, including a better random
ge=
nerator.  Once I get beyond this next milestone, I'll release an
improved v=
ersion.

Thanks a lot for your input, if you still can't get it to run, don=
't
hesitate to reply and I'll try to help you as best I can.


--- In neat@=
yahoogroups.com, "afcarl2" <a.carl@...> wrote:
>
> Jason,
> 
>    Review of=
 the NEAT portion of the HyperNEAT code indicates that 
> speciate (and siz=
e thereof via pushback), is only called from 
> adjustFitness, which is cal=
led from ExperimentRun::finishEvaluations. 
> The seeming signifcance of th=
is is that the size of species is zero for 
> generation 0, which in itself=
 is not a problem, but there results an 
> exception in
> GeneticPopulation=
::produceNextGeneration, associated with a call to 
> getSpecies. Since the=
 species ID is undefined for generation 0 (since 
> speciate has not yet be=
en called), the test "if(species[a]-
> >getID()=3D=3Did)" will not be true.=
 Was this intended? Please advise.
> 
> Thanks,
>    Andy Carl
>
